website_summaries.verdict: Young fans of the Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood series will enjoy the opportunity to engage with classic characters from the Mister Rogers era.
pros: Game play encourages basic counting and interactivity
Designed for 2 to 4 players ages 2 to 6
Includes many popular puppet characters from Land of Make Believe
cons: Contains many small parts, not safe for toddlers
Game play may be too advanced for younger kids

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids who struggle with not always winning.
customer_reviews.text: Game was more than we expected, bc it teaches your child to help others along in the game. Great socio-emotional learning tool. Recommend for ABA therapists and parents dealing with Autism or ADD for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Fanna Nicole Smith

customer_reviews.title: Written description doesn't match box information.
customer_reviews.text: We haven't played the game yet but as I was reading the directions I noticed the box says its for 3 years old and up. The description, in 2 places, says it's for 2 years old and up. That is why I bought it. My grandson isn't 3 for another 4 months. I think he can still play with extra help but that was frustrating. Over all it looks like a good game.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Too much going on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 year olds because they love Daniel tiger. We've tried to play it twice so far and there's just too much going on for them to actually play it the way it's intended. I also bought four other games like super why, hungry caterpillar, stack the blocks, and sneaky snacky squirrel and they were able to play all of those board games a lot easier. I suppose I'll put this away until they are a little older.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: A must have for Daniel Tiger fans!
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a gift for a 3yr old and his mother said he loved it. She said he was really excited to play since he loves Daniel Tiger and he had fun playing as a family. She felt it offered him a great way to play, to learn, and to follow along in a way that was easy for him, do our gift was a hit. I will certainly buy this again for another child who loves Daniel Tiger.
customer_reviews.author: Sanriobaby

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little lessons in a fun game for small children.
customer_reviews.text: This game is so sweet and makes using your manners fun. My son and I have played it so many times and it makes my heart happy that his favorite part is when he gets to give a gift. It's helped him remember to be grateful, feel the joy of making someone else happy with a gift, and understand that winning is not what makes a game fun.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: It’s an okay game. My 4 year old likes it but way to complicated for my 2.5 yr old. You go around the board (in any direction you choose during your turn) and get tokens then go to the finish spot. There are tree spots which you get a card (either move 1 or 2 spaces or a go to and get a token card). There are also gift spots which you give a token away. I personally don’t like the gift spots and my 4 year old as already figured out you can avoid them based on which way you choose to move.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Kind of confusing to play
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this game but I’m not crazy about the actual game. I think the game is a little more complicated than it should be for be for the age range it is marketed for. We’ve had this game for a month and already a few pieces are starting to chip away on the edges. The thing I do like about this is that it literally brings the world of Daniel Tiger to life. There is no other game or toy that is Daniel Tiger related that has the whole neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Cute game with great lesson.
customer_reviews.text: Super cute game. Teaches kindness and sharing. I love you say "Thank you" and it doesn't involve being sneaky or stealing like other games tend to focus on. My 4 year old loves it. Easy rules but still kept his attention. My only small complaint is the game characters do not stay in their stands when you pick them up to move them, so I had to glue them it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Fun kid's game!
customer_reviews.text: My son got this for his 4th birthday and he loves it. It's educational and entertaining for him and the adults don't mind it either. He's fairly new to board games, but I think this is his favorite. He's excited to get to say "thank you" to characters that he's familiar with.
customer_reviews.author: ksquared

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old makes us play this 4-5 times a day! She LOVES it!!! We've only had it for a week but it's well used. And this kid has a ton of toys games and books. A favorite in our house for sure. Also, it teaches little ones to say "thank you" after receiving a "gift".
customer_reviews.author: Mxd Chx

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: The game is so cute! But mine came with a lot of missing pieces. You need a spinner in order to move your player, and mine was not included in the box. The players also require a plastic stand, to move along the board, and those weren’t included either. All the paper products were there, but I’m thinking the bag of plastic pieces got left out. So we aren’t able to enjoy the game :/ it has a fun teaching concept though, and would be fun if all the pieces were here!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Tammerine

customer_reviews.title: LOVE that requires kids to share
customer_reviews.text: This is SUCH a great game. I got it bc my kiddo loves Daniel Tiger, but I had no idea that it would also teach wonderful lessons as they are learning to play games. This game actually requires kids to share as part of the game - it goes a long way toward teaching good sportsmanship in game playing.
customer_reviews.author: HAP

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Utterly confusing game with way too many rules for a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: genacat

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this game for our son!!! Not too difficult and fun to play since it’s his favorite show. Only negative is the character pieces tend to fall out of the stands. I’ll probably just super glue them on so we don’t have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game for younger players, maybe boring for older kids
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty simple game. My 2 year old loves it. My 5 year old will also play it with him, but prefers more challenging games. Only complaint is the little plastic holders for the character get pieces don't work super well.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool for toddlers and family game time.
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter is a very bright 2 1/2 year old and is getting the concept. The pieces are easy for her to handle. Good for learning the concept of taking turns, counting, and general introduction to game playing.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great for family play time!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandkids ages 4 and 2. My daughter said it is the best game for teaching kids kindness and sharing! I'm so glad I got this one instead of the other game I had been looking at.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Too many pieces,complicated for young children
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment. This game has way too many pieces, small pieces and is inappropriate for young children. A Daniel Tiger game just needed to be simple and cute and durable. Everything is made of cardboard. My girls easily broke the game board by folding it incorrectly. Also takes too long to set up.
customer_reviews.author: CRIS ST

customer_reviews.title: Great Toddler Learning Game
customer_reviews.text: For any young fans of Daniel Tiger, this game makes them feel like they are traveling all around the neighborhood of Make Believe. The mechanics of the game are perfect for young toddlers and incorporate number recognition, matching skills, counting, pathfinding, and practicing their manners. While grown-ups may find this a little repetitive, you will see your toddler's mind working and growing during play, which is a great reward in itself.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dezso

customer_reviews.title: Cute game
customer_reviews.text: My kids love Daniel and they were very happy with this game. You go around the town and collect a piece for your game card. First one to fill their card wins. Fun family game for smaller kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: My daughter LOVES this game!!
customer_reviews.text: This game has become a family favorite. It is easy to play and my daughter loves it. She is 2 almost 3 years old and she loves “walking” through the different paths to get to each shop
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with barely any rules
customer_reviews.text: Got for my 4 yo for Xmas and he set it up himself without help. He and my two daughters ages 7 and 8 also love playing this together. It’s simple and easy to get the hang of. Perfect for little kids.
customer_reviews.author: Sreitzmas

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: I have a four-year-old and a three-year-old and they both love this game. They each got the concept pretty quickly, so it’s relatively simple, and it’s a great way to spend some family time.
customer_reviews.author: Katarina S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice for older child
customer_reviews.text: Nice game and great concept, but made for a child that already likes board games and understands following game rules. It says it’s for a 3 year old, but it’s not a good first board game for a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Fun for three year olds & their families.
customer_reviews.text: Fun game for toddlers. Good use of using words with “thank you cards”. We have difficulty keeping the characters on their plastic stands which can make it a little less sun for toddlers. Overall we recommend this game.
customer_reviews.author: House of Cats

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful game. It even teaches kids how to be excited about helping other people win (& dealing with the complex feelings from that). Excellent game for an excellent show.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Game
customer_reviews.text: My family enjoy the game, however the stands that the character pieces go into would often fall off. I had to tape them onto the pieces. Not worth paying $24 but $10 or $12 is OK
customer_reviews.author: TN

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter loves this game.
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter is 3 1/2 and she loves this game. She picked up how to play quickly. She loves Daniel Tiger so this was the prefect gift to send her during the quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: A game we can all agree on
customer_reviews.text: This game is enjoyable and easy to play. Both my children love it, even the 8 year old who has outgrown Daniel Tiger. Some game pieces are not essential and make it more complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Ree Nae

customer_reviews.title: Fun and helps little ones learn about rules of board games
customer_reviews.text: 3 year old daughter and 5 year old daughter both enjoy it. Board is a little confusing with so many path options. But with help and patience it is a good learning game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the 3 or 4yo Daniel Tiger fan in your life.
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with both the quality of this game and the mechanics. Includes all the major characters as either play pieces or on the board. Nice balance of cooperative and competitive gameplay.
customer_reviews.author: KehlFamily

customer_reviews.title: Just Right for Little Ones
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this game for our Daniel Tiger loving 3 year old. The game is built on concepts and goals that are easy for him to understand and enjoy. Just right for our son.
customer_reviews.author: Sam B.

customer_reviews.title: A must for your little neighbor
customer_reviews.text: Though simple, this game is great for Daniel Tiger obsesssed tots like mine. I also love that it includes concepts such as gifting and replying “thank you” and other elements of cooperative play.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Adorable!
customer_reviews.text: My three-year-old grandson understood the concept immediately and proceeded to play with joy. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Havens

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So fun! My 2.5 year olds can play it without too much frustration
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Y.

customer_reviews.title: Good Game
customer_reviews.text: My daughter likes Danielle Tiger, and this was a great game for her. This is helping her count, and play games better.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Daniel Tiger
customer_reviews.text: Cute game. Doesn't take long and there is a tiny bit of strategy involved. I love hearing my daughter tell her sister, "Oh, thank you Megan!" (When she's given a gift) Would recommend for small children. Mine are 5 1/2.
customer_reviews.author: Tina V

customer_reviews.title: Great game with a positive message
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game and we've enjoyed playing it a number of times. I love the kindness and positivity in this game even as there is a winner/loser.
customer_reviews.author: Vireo

customer_reviews.title: A little difficult for a 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my 3 and 5 year old to play. The paths were difficult for my 3 year old to follow, but my 5 year old did alright. Cute game. We love the show and it makes great connections to the characters and places on the show.
customer_reviews.author: Sabre Tillman

customer_reviews.title: Game arrived as promised/in great shape. The little 4 year old that we ...
customer_reviews.text: Game arrived as promised/in great shape. The little 4 year old that we gave it to as a gift loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute Game
customer_reviews.text: We love playing this game with our 3-year-old. Only 4 stars because the spinner never worked so right now we are using an app to figure out how many spaces to move.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley B.

customer_reviews.title: So much better than Candy Land.
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! So impressed with the art, construction, and the game play. Toss out candy land and get this game!
customer_reviews.author: C. Eckman

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to play this with my granddaughters. The pieces are large and the rules are easy.
customer_reviews.author: PWH

customer_reviews.title: Not for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Son tried to play it but was too confusing for a 4 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Chingony

customer_reviews.title: Great game for a 4 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 4 y/o granddaughter loves this game, that's good enough for me :)
customer_reviews.author: daschultz

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my recently turned 4 year old who loves Daniel and he LOVES this game. So perfect for him. Even reinforces manners.
customer_reviews.author: L. Newz

customer_reviews.title: Great game for very small child
customer_reviews.text: This was fun to play good for a 3 year old!
customer_reviews.author: Cristen Owens

customer_reviews.title: Great little game
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't all that sheer. Could have been a little thicker. Totally age appropriate. My three year old loves it.
customer_reviews.author: ian foster

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better then expected. All piecesof the game set up have great detail.
customer_reviews.author: oscar

customer_reviews.title: Cute, fun game for little kids!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 & 5 yr olds for Christmas and they loved it! Super cute game and easy to understand. Game can be played in under 10 mins
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Quick and fun
customer_reviews.text: My 4 1/2 year old asks to play this everyday. The board split in half when she tried to fold it the wrong way, but we can still play with it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Cute game
customer_reviews.text: Very cute game! My 3year old and 5 year old like to play this. It helps to teach good manners, like saying “thank you”.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Good game
customer_reviews.text: Perfect game for my Daniel loving 3-year old. Simple enough for her to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Holly K.

customer_reviews.title: Daniel Tiger for the Win!
customer_reviews.text: Such a cute little game! And you can’t beat $6!
customer_reviews.author: mamallamaof8

customer_reviews.title: Eh. It’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cheaply made and not the most inventive or interesting game.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Brown

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice game, my daughter enjoys playing it
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice game, my daughter enjoys playing it. The only problem is the spinner is kind of stuck, making it hard for her to turn.
customer_reviews.author: ThisIsMyPenName

customer_reviews.title: Not for young kids
customer_reviews.text: Fun game, but hard to understand for kids younger than 6. There are lots of pieces to the game.
customer_reviews.author: K. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Not a great game for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Cute idea for a game but there are too many little pieces. By the time you get it set up the kids have lost interest.
customer_reviews.author: pegleg

customer_reviews.title: and not really fun or entertaining at all
customer_reviews.text: This game was a little confusing, and not really fun or entertaining at all.
customer_reviews.author: BJS777

customer_reviews.title: Great game for little ones learning how to play board games.
customer_reviews.text: I play this game with my 2 1/2 year old who is learning board games. We needed a break from Candyland over quarantine and this game is perfect for her with just a few reminders of what to do next.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Daniel Tiger fans
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old and I really enjoy this game!! So cute
customer_reviews.author: Lauren C.

customer_reviews.title: Cute game, perfect gift!
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my nephew and he loved it! So much fun for kiddos who love Daniel tiger!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great! My 3 and 6 year old love playing this game
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great for Daniel loving little ones!
customer_reviews.text: I play this game with my 3 year old over and over again everyday. She loves it. I thought there might be too many parts or rules for her to grasp but it hasn't been an issue at all. I'm really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ficklin

customer_reviews.title: She loves Daniel Tiger!!
customer_reviews.text: Very cute game, easy for a 3 year old to play!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This game teaches kindness, giving, and manners...my sons who are 3 and 5 love playing this game. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Halls

customer_reviews.title: Easy Toddler Game
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas Gift for my son (3) and daughter (5). They love it! Play it multiple times a day, easy for them to play without adult help.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Howell

customer_reviews.title: Super cute, easy for toddler
customer_reviews.text: Super cute game! My 3.5 year old loves it and so do I!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I got that for my niece. She is 3 years okd and she loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: PBH

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My daughter couldn’t wait to play it, over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Harmony

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ‘first game’ for little kids.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 y/o. It’s fantastic! Teaches sharing, patience, manners & manages to be done in a way that will match the attention span of a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Reinertsen

customer_reviews.title: overly complicated for 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: Much clunkier of a board game than i expected. Too much going on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very fun game, my two year old is obsessed with ...
customer_reviews.text: Very fun game, my two year old is obsessed with Daniel Tiger and LOVES this game. My 5 year old son can get into it also. Simple family fun!
customer_reviews.author: Krawmamaskitchen

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Pieces of the game were missing when we opened it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for manners and helping
customer_reviews.text: My 3-year old loved the game! It’s so cute and is really good with manners and helping others!
customer_reviews.author: Travis B Bledsoe

customer_reviews.title: missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: This game did not have a spinner inside the box so we are not able to play the game
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddler ages
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 3yr old. The game is easy to understand except I don't like multi direction gameboard. That concept seems hard to grasp. He loves the independence of putting the game together
customer_reviews.author: Katie Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to play and kids enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Christmas.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my toddler Daniel tiger finatic as a big reward and we were both disappointed. The spinner broke in half within minutes. Prince Wednesday is not a game piece. The game was complicated for my three year old. Materials are cheap and flimsy. Perhaps worst thing is the sheer amount of pieces...Twenty little circles the size of a nickle are critical to game play! Also comes with a dozen or so cards, and many other pieces. Toddlers lose stuff and I hate having to keep track of and clean up a million little things. Returning this and will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: amarie82amarie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to explain and play
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew's 4th birthday. He played it with my 3 yr old and they both were able to play with help. Easy to explain and play. I liked that it had math applicable math concepts. Perfect for Daniel lovers!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.L

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely adorable game. My 4 year old and I love playing this.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle M

customer_reviews.title: First board game
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter's first board game. She loves Daniel Tiger, so she'll happily learn to take turns, follow directions, and will have a fun time with mom & dad, who are big board game fans,
customer_reviews.author: BayLady

customer_reviews.title: Big hit with Daniel Fans!
customer_reviews.text: Big hit with the 4-year-old recipient and family :) They are big Daniel fans, and they LOVED this!
customer_reviews.author: mcl@ca

customer_reviews.title: our post office is great, so there was no damage
customer_reviews.text: I understand that it says that you can tell what the item is from the package, but there was no package! They slapped a label on the game and sent it that way. Thankfully, our post office is great, so there was no damage, and I was the one to open the door, not my toddler (Guys, come on, it's Christmas time). The product itself seems great. My daughter will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure she will love it considering she loves anything Danial Tiger
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my granddaughter and she has not played with it yet. I myself am dying to know how she likes this game too! I'm sure she will love it considering she loves anything Danial Tiger!
customer_reviews.author: Kerri Stgermain

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: My daugher loves this game. Is a little different as in you want to win but have to give gifts away and be happy about it. My daughter loves to win because she is 4 so she doesnt understand why she would help me win. But in all its super fun and it teaches how to give and say please and thank you. She loves daniel tiger its a game that is great for toddlers
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Cox

product_meta.title: Daniel Tiger's Welcome to Mainstreet
product_meta.description: Children visit the Neighborhood of Make-Believe in Welcome to Main Street, a Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood game, by Briarpatch. This fun game encourages interactive gameplay while building social skills. Simple counting and coordination skills are reinforced throughout the game as players stop by shops on Main Street to collect items for their backpacks always remembering to say "thank you!" Briarpatch is recognized world wide for it's well-designed preschool games and puzzles. For 2-4 players, ages 2 to 6 years old.
feature_bullets: Children visit the Neighborhood of Make-Believe in Welcome to Main Street, a Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood game, by Briarpatch
Encourages interactive gameplay and builds social skills
Briarpatch is recognized world wide for it's well-designed preschool games and puzzles
For 2-4 players, ages 2 to 6 years old
